hero.subtitle: First aid kits for medics, evacuation teams, volunteers, and the military

steps.title: You make a donation
steps.description: The cost of one first aid kit is $80.

steps.title: We order medkits
steps.description: UNIONTAC works with trusted Ukrainian manufacturers, and all the medkits are assembled in Kyiv.

steps.title: We deliver medkits directly to the frontline
steps.description: Our volunteers deliver these life-saving supplies without delay, despite the daily shelling and threats.

steps.title: Medkits save lives
steps.description: Our dedicated team monitors the distribution and impact of each medical kit. We maintain constant communication with field units to understand their evolving needs.

medkit.title: First aid kits save lives
medkit.description1: First aid kits are one of the most sought-after and essential supplies in the war zone.
medkit.description2: One first aid kit can save two lives, increasing the chances of survival and allowing evacuation from the combat zone.

cta.title: Mad war continues
cta.paragraph1: Drones, bombs, missiles, and artillery are killing people, sparing neither women nor children.
cta.paragraph2: Those on the front lines are giving their lives to protect their families, homes, freedom and justice. And they need our help.
cta.paragraph3: For a year now, we have been providing life-saving first aid kits.

statistics.title: UNIONTAC in numbers
statistics.subtitle: War doesn't stop, so we work 24/7

brigades.title: Brigades and volunteer groups supported with first-aid kits

aboutUs.title: We are Sveta, Kira, and >100 volunteers
aboutUs.paragraph1: Sveta is from Crimea, and Kira is from Kharkiv. Since the first day of the full-scale invasion, we have been helping refugees, volunteers, medics, and military personnel. A year ago, we opened our own foundation, UNIONTAC, and we supply first aid kits directly to the front.
aboutUs.paragraph2: For the military, there are no weekends, holidays, or the possibility to "leave" the front. The enemy doesn't know the word "rest," and every day, our warriors stand at the forefront, at the cost of their health and lives.
